job_title: Senior Admissions Representative in Riverside, CA
pros: Being treated like an adult, being held accountable, great work/life balance, amazing leadership
cons: No CONS AT ALL!!!! Amazing place to work

pros: Decent pay better than other colleges, not a toxic environment. They don't micromanage great management from the president to Director. They provide health insurance and 401k.
cons: The pay could be better considering you have a quota so it's sales but it caps in the 80s after 15 years of experience.

pros: Great friendly environment, not high pressure you won't be micro manages here. They care about the students and go above and beyond to make sure they are successful this gives us good reviews from students. The base is good you get salary increases every year up to a certain point. Good health insurance and they have 401K
cons: The only downside I can think of is the salary increases are slow so some years you get a very small bump and have to wait a few years to get the bigger bump I wish that the salary increased higher than the max considering this is sales we should always have incentives to meet are quota.

review_title: STAY AWAY!! DO NOT WORK HERE!
pros: Thanks to working here, I met a VERY few great people. That is the only thing that was a pro about working here.
cons: I have NEVER EVER worked in such a toxic environment. Where the "superior" gossips all-day long along with one of the team members about the rest of the team. They spend hours in her office gossiping. Working there made my stomach hurt! I advise that you do not work for this company.

review_title: Not a good place to work
job_title: Full Time Faculty in Alhambra, CA
pros: Short commute and nice built environment.

review_title: A bad experience where they just want you to pass students so they get paid.
pros: There are none as it is a terrible place to work.
cons: Very low pay, few hours, want a masters degree yet no say in the curriculum and FYI the curriculum is utter crap, department chairs have no business being in leadership positions as they are highly unqualified

job_title: Career Services Advisor in Anaheim, CA
pros: Gain experience, work with small teams, .
cons: Very small school, little opportunity to get a promotion.

job_title: Director of Career Services in Los Angeles, CA
pros: It's a good place to work.

review_title: I feel bad for the teachers but especually the part timers .
pros: For part timers I cannot think of a SINGLE reason to work here. They wont hire any full time because they do not want to pay benefits. I'm one of the lucky ones but I'm being asked to teach courses that I have no qualifications for.
cons: The pay is horrible for the qualifications that the teachers have. Sr. management seems intent on squeezing every penny they can out of the school. One poor adjunct had his hours cut in half without warning but he is loyal , hardworking and is very dedicated to his students success. Most of the other teachers are looking for jobs and  two department heads just quit. Who's going to run this place when they are all gone???? Its a mess here. If you are considering being an adjunct here beware.

review_title: Great environment/students, horrible corporate level management
job_title: Student Services in El Monte, CA
pros:
Very few aside from the colleagues and students you work with on a daily basis. 
The surrounding landscape is serene and enjoyable.
cons:
Too many to name...
There is an INCREDIBLY HIGH amount of turnover amongst staff and management level employees.
Student and employee concerns are never taken into consideration by upper management.
As an employee, receiving the support you need is essential to succeeding at any level. 
No incentives or recognition for employees. Want your staff to remain happy and hard working? Then LISTEN!! 
Corporate level management needs to understand what employees do, day in and day out, to make this place function! Without those loyal few, I don't know where Platt would be. 
Having previously worked for a for profit post secondary college, the inconsistencies found at Platt are far too great in comparison. 
No structure, incentives, pay raises, or respect for employees. 
Had I known this before, I would have NEVER taken employment there.

pros: Great co workers, try to train us and unfortunately a miss, but the intent is there.   HR was always on top of it.
cons:
Upper management unorganized
No structure in place
Constant changes
Micromanagement 
Lazy supervisor 
No encouragement 
Lastly, not listening to employees when they offer opinion.

pros: Nothing is positive about this place.
cons: Upper management is not healthy or stable. I do not recommend this, especially when you hear and know that the campus president is cursing out and bad mouthing employees. Very terrible vibes. They will take you out to a nice dinner when you meet your quota and then chew you out the next month. Not the best tactic for a moral booster.

pros: Ethical company, great benefits that include strong medical, dental and vision coverage, as well as life insurance, etc. Competitive salary. Pretty location and remodeled.
cons: Not a lot of opportunities to move up

job_title: IT Support in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Love the people and faculty and great work environment.
cons: There are no cons that I have to leave on here and it is a great place to work

pros: This campus provides a solid work-life balance, good atmosphere, friendly management
